intro: Cicerbita crassicaulis, commonly known as the broad-stemmed cicerbit, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, often hairy stems and compound leaves. It typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and is native to regions of Europe and Asia. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its fruits are dry, ribbed capsules that contain several seeds. Cicerbita crassicaulis is sometimes cultivated for its edible leaves, though it can be toxic if consumed in large quantities.
